summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020, forwarding a September 2019 exchange between attorneys Brittany Henderson and Brad Edwards and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York. The AUSA requests emails and photographs from a victim/witness related to her encounters with Jeffrey Epstein, and Henderson and Edwards coordinate to provide them.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with Brad Edwards and an AUSA regarding providing documents and photographs of a victim/witness from the relevant time period.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney who will send emails and coordinates with Brittany Henderson to provide documents, including photographs, to the AUSA.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of encounters described in emails sought by the AUSA from a victim/witness.

connections.description: Attorneys coordinating to provide documents and photographs related to a victim/witness to the AUSA.
Henderson is an attorney handling documents related to a victim/witness's encounters with Epstein.

events.title: AUSA Request for Victim/Witness Documents
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York emails Brittany Henderson requesting emails and photographs from a victim/witness related to her encounters with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Coordination to Provide Photographs
events.description: Brittany Henderson emails the AUSA, attaching two photographs of the victim/witness from the relevant time period and stating she and Brad Edwards will provide documents when back in the office.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: An Assistant United States Attorney from the SDNY is actively seeking evidence (emails and photographs) from a victim/witness regarding her encounters with Jeffrey Epstein in September 2019.
Attorneys Brittany Henderson and Brad Edwards are in possession of, and coordinating the transfer of, these victim/witness documents to federal prosecutors.
The victim/witness had previously met with the AUSA in California and indicated willingness to share her evidence.
The document shows ongoing investigative cooperation between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors in the Epstein case.
